authors.name: Martin Fowler
authors.biography: British software developer, author, and international speaker on software development. Known for refactoring, microservices, and agile methodologies.

authors.name: Joshua Bloch
authors.biography: American software engineer and author. Former Chief Java Architect at Google. Known for Effective Java and contributions to Java Collections Framework.

authors.name: Erich Gamma
authors.biography: Swiss computer scientist and co-author of Design Patterns. Lead developer of Eclipse and Microsoft Visual Studio Code.

authors.name: Kent Beck
authors.biography: American software engineer and creator of Extreme Programming and Test-Driven Development. Pioneer of agile software development.

authors.name: Brian Kernighan
authors.biography: Canadian computer scientist who co-authored The C Programming Language with Dennis Ritchie. Professor at Princeton University.

authors.name: Bjarne Stroustrup
authors.biography: Danish computer scientist and creator of C++ programming language. Managing Director at Morgan Stanley and visiting professor at Columbia University.

authors.name: Gayle Laakmann McDowell
authors.biography: Software engineer and author. Founder of CareerCup. Former engineer at Google, Microsoft, and Apple. Known for technical interview preparation books.

authors.name: Michael Feathers
authors.biography: American software consultant and author specializing in legacy code and agile development practices.

authors.name: Sandi Metz
authors.biography: American software engineer, author, and international speaker. Known for object-oriented design and Ruby programming expertise.

authors.name: Steve McConnell
authors.biography: American software engineer and author. CEO of Construx Software. Known for Code Complete and software construction best practices.

categories.name: Software Architecture
categories.description: Books about designing large-scale software systems, architectural patterns, and system design principles.

categories.name: Object-Oriented Design
categories.description: Books covering OOP principles, design patterns, SOLID principles, and object-oriented programming best practices.

categories.name: Testing & Quality Assurance
categories.description: Books about software testing, test-driven development, quality assurance, and writing maintainable test code.

categories.name: Programming Languages
categories.description: Books focused on specific programming languages like Java, C, C++, and their advanced features.

categories.name: Career Development
categories.description: Books about software engineering careers, technical interviews, coding challenges, and professional growth.

categories.name: Legacy Code & Refactoring
categories.description: Books about working with existing codebases, refactoring techniques, and improving code quality.

categories.name: Agile & Methodologies
categories.description: Books about agile development, extreme programming, scrum, and software development methodologies.

books.title: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code
books.description: Martin Fowler's guide to refactoring, improving code structure without changing external behavior. Covers code smells, refactoring techniques, and maintaining clean codebases. Essential for working with legacy systems.

books.title: Effective Java
books.description: Joshua Bloch's definitive guide to Java programming best practices. Covers 90 rules covering effective Java patterns, generics, concurrency, serialization, and more. Must-read for serious Java developers.

books.title: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
books.description: The Gang of Four classic that introduced 23 design patterns for object-oriented software. Covers creational, structural, and behavioral patterns. Foundation for modern software architecture.

books.title: Test Driven Development: By Example
books.description: Kent Beck's introduction to Test-Driven Development. Learn to write tests first, then code. Includes practical examples in Java and Python. Revolutionizes software development approach.

books.title: The C Programming Language
books.description: The definitive guide to C programming by its creators. Known as K&R, this book covers C fundamentals, pointers, data structures, and Unix system programming. Classic reference for C developers.

books.title: The C++ Programming Language
books.description: Bjarne Stroustrup's comprehensive guide to C++ by the language's creator. Covers C++11 features, templates, STL, object-oriented programming, and modern C++ best practices.

books.title: Cracking the Coding Interview
books.description: The ultimate guide to technical interview preparation. 189 programming questions with solutions, covering data structures, algorithms, system design, and behavioral interviews. Essential for job seekers.

books.title: Working Effectively with Legacy Code
books.description: Michael Feathers' guide to maintaining and improving legacy systems. Covers dependency breaking, testing legacy code, refactoring strategies, and working with code you didn't write.

books.title: Practical Object-Oriented Design
books.description: Sandi Metz's guide to object-oriented design in Ruby. Covers SOLID principles, dependency management, testing, and creating flexible, maintainable applications. Applicable to any OO language.

books.title: Code Complete: A Practical Handbook of Software Construction
books.description: Steve McConnell's comprehensive guide to software construction. Covers coding techniques, debugging, testing, and software craftsmanship. One of the most influential programming books ever written.

books.title: Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture
books.description: Martin Fowler's catalog of patterns for enterprise application development. Covers domain logic, data source, web presentation, distribution, and offline concurrency patterns.

books.title: Extreme Programming Explained
books.description: Kent Beck's introduction to Extreme Programming methodology. Covers pair programming, test-driven development, continuous integration, and agile practices that revolutionized software development.
